page.title: 19HARECASTLE TUNNEL KIDSGROVE
page.content: A dominant feature of the area is the Trent and Mersey Canal, one of the earliest Brindley canals. It formerly had an extensive narrow-boat traffic between the Potteries and the Mersey. In recent years this traffic had declined severely. The canal is now used for pleasure boats. It is expensive to maintain because the area is subject to mining subsidence. On its way through the area the canal passes through the Harecastle Tunnel. The original entrance from the Cheshire side has been blocked off and a new one constructed. The entrance is well sign posted from The Avenue and from the railway station at Kidsgrove. While re-lining work was being carried out in 1984 a number of canal workers were trapped and had to be rescued by firemen.
